title: INtopBackup
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Can't sleep? Journalist Jennifer Senior says you're not alone in your insomnia
items.description: Pulitzer Prize-winning writer Jennifer Senior has had insomnia for 25 years. Her new piece in The Atlantic is about her often futile attempts to fall ...

items.title: The intended and unintended consequences of wolf reintroduction programs
items.description: Heath Druzin talks about what he learned about coexisting with wolves while making his podcast Howl, from Boise State Public Radio.

items.title: When it comes to vaccines, how are pediatricians restoring trust?
items.description: NPR's Pien Huang speaks with pediatrician Alexandra Cvijanovich and Professor Jason L. Schwartz about trying to shore up trust about vaccines.

items.title: Meet the woman who's reunited dozens of people with lost photos after the LA fires
items.description: We look at an Altadena resident who has made it her mission to help reunite keepsakes that survived the LA fires — photos, kids art, postcards — with ...

items.title: Floods are getting more dangerous around the country, not just in Texas
items.description: The deadly floods in Central Texas were caused by extremely heavy rain. Climate change is causing even more rain to fall during the heaviest storms.

items.title: Debate erupts over role job cuts played in weather forecasts ahead of deadly Texas floods
items.description: Former federal officials and outside experts have warned for months that President Donald Trump’s staffing cuts to the National Weather Service could ...

items.title: U.S. tariffs on European goods threaten consumers on both sides of Atlantic
items.description: EU said it was prepared to retaliate with tariffs on hundreds of American products, from U.S. beef, auto parts and beer to Boeing airplanes.

items.title: Watch: Moment pet lion pounces on woman in street
items.description: CCTV footage shows the moment a lion leaps over a concrete wall before attacking a woman.

items.title: Girls camp grieves loss of 27 campers and counselors in Texas floods that killed nearly 90 people
US to remove Syria's HTS from list of foreign terror groups
items.description: The Islamist group led a rebel offensive that toppled Syria's Assad regime in December.

items.title: Camp Mystic confirms 27 campers and counselors killed in Texas flooding
items.description: Dozens of people have died in the Texas flooding that struck on the Fourth of July.

items.title: Young campers, teachers and football coach among Texas flood victims
items.description: At least 91 lives were lost near the Guadalupe River after a deluge on Friday, authorities say.

items.title: 4 clear signs that bankruptcy is your best option now
items.description: Think bankruptcy sounds extreme? These warning signs signal that it might be the best bet for your finances.

items.title: Here's where you can donate to help Central Texas flood recovery
items.description: Several organizations are accepting donations for those impacted by the floods, as well as first responders and volunteers.

items.title: At least 10 dead in Kenya protests as central Nairobi sealed off
items.description: These are the latest in a wave of anti-government protests over the past year.

items.title: Trump to put 25% tariffs on Japan and South Korea
2 Dallas girls killed in flooding at Camp Mystic, families say
items.description: Three girls from Dallas, 8-year-olds Hadley Hanna and Eloise Peck and 9-year-old Lila Bonner, were among the missing Camp Mystic campers.

items.title: Watch: Timelapse shows how suddenly Texas flood waters rose
items.description: Footage shows how the banks of the Llano River rose quickly over the course of an hour.
